abstract: China’s banking regulator told lenders last month to conduct a new round of stress tests to gauge the impact of residential property prices falling as much as 60 percent in the hardest-hit markets, Bloomberg News reported.
snippet: China’s banking regulator told lenders last month to conduct a new round of stress tests to gauge the impact of residential property prices falling as much as 60 percent in the hardest-hit markets, Bloomberg News reported.
lead_paragraph: China’s banking regulator told lenders last month to conduct a new round of stress tests to gauge the impact of residential property prices falling as much as 60 percent in the hardest-hit markets, Bloomberg News reported, citing a person with knowledge of the matter.

headline.main: China Said to Conduct its Own Stress Tests
